name: SLS Hotel at Beverly Hills

reviews.text: We put on an event at the SLS and arranged for 100+ guests to stay here. The hotel is beautiful, modern and sleek including the rooms, event spaces and the Bazaar. The staff was very accommodating and did a great job for our event. The food and drinks were very well done and met all of our expectations.
reviews.title: Sleek Hotel

reviews.text: We received rave reviews from all of our guests. I would highly recommend this hotel for business and/or putting on an event.
reviews.title: Great customer service

reviews.text: Excellent hotel but even better customer service. In particular, Stacy P at reception was not only efficient but supremely welcoming. She made the experience for us. Hope to come back in the near future.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hate this hotel. This is the Kardashian of the hotel world, it's trashy and it thinks its a night club. Staff are friendly but they haven't been trained at all, the service is pretty poor and the prices are pretty up there for the quality. The bedroom mirrors are so darkly tinted I couldn't do my make up and there's a stale smell everywhere.
reviews.title: Welcome to hollywood!!

reviews.text: The pool area is horrid, the decor is dated and they blast tinny bad electronic music. The loungers are old and the staff are badly turned out.
reviews.title: Just average…

reviews.text: Ciel Spa is the only spa that I've been to in my life. I usually opt for the one hour deep tissue massage. Jovanni is my therapist of choice. I'm a strong, athletic guy and Jovanni is pettite but she gives a legit deep tissue massage. The pressure she uses is amazing! There is a significant discount for local residents so make sure to mention this to the staff. The venue is very clean. Plenty of amenities that will suit your needs. A spa reservation will give you access to their local fitness center and rooftop pool. The pool is only available for spa guests during the weekdays but is my favorite perk.
reviews.title: Ciel Spa Review

reviews.text: Stayed here while on a work trip to Los Angeles. While a bit edgey on the design side, I liked it and enjoyed the layout of the lobby. The restaurant was terriifc. The room layout was not that functional and was a bit on the dark side. The location, while near a lot of good restaurants was a bit of the beaten path, not being in the hub od West Hollywood and definitely not being in Beverly Hills. Would I stay here again, sure, but there are better options in the area.
reviews.title: The good and the bad average out to just plain average

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel from the valet to the front desk made each and every portion of our experience memorable, comfortable, positive, and happy. The staff was beautiful from the inside out and this is not often my experience in luxury hotels. This place rocks, and the location was great. The pool party was unforgettable. If you decide to turn down and opportunity to stay at this exquisite, modern-style, mirror-mecca, you are doing yourself a disservice.
reviews.title: Excellent Accommodations

reviews.text: Big thanks to the staff at the hotel for really putting service first. I have stayed on the property on two different occasions over the span of three weeks and my stay has been consistent in high marks. The concierge and ties to SBE entertainment is an absolute plus for enjoying the evening with clients or group of friends.
reviews.title: Fantastic and a must stay hotel.

reviews.text: Still a comfortable full featured hotel (suitable for holiday or business), while being a little more edgy. Great food offering for casual and more formal dining (The Bazaar). All staff helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Modern, fashionable but still comfortable

reviews.text: Great location, very accessible in business area of Beverly Hills.
reviews.title: Convenient. Upscale. Approachable

reviews.text: Convenient in and out parking (one daily charge) with friendly attentive valet staff.
reviews.title: 14 HOURS OF BIRTHDAY BLISS

reviews.text: The pool on rooftop is an oasis and very kid/family friendly while still appealing to the younger, professional crowd. The pool staff is very attentive. Full selection of drinks (pricey though) and food at pool is a limited selection with very small portions (pricey as well).
reviews.title: Looks like they are trying...

reviews.text: Room service was quick, efficient and rather reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great pick!

reviews.text: Very nice outside (covered) lobby lounge where you can sit comfortably and enjoy people watching with a drink.
reviews.title: trendy/funky hotel - very hollywood

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in the SLS Beverly Hills, as soon as I walked in I fell in love with everything pure luxury. The rooftop pool is perfect for relaxation and parties. Our room was a good size, a little dark, but I didn't need to apply makeup so I was fine. The concierge recommended a fantastic restaurant called Picca, all staff were friendly and helpful. The attached restaurant, The Bazar, continues the theme of the hotel, great atmosphere. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Loved the SLS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Impossible to sleep or take a nap on Saturdays between 2PM-6PM as the music from the roof-top pool is deafening. I was on the 2nd floor with closed doors and shades.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel in a great location

description: SLS Hotel at Beverly Hills offers guests a luxurious and elegant hospitality experience in the heart of Los Angeles' vibrant landscape, located just a block from The Beverly Center.
